waver.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to become weaker or less certain
waver.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The studentsâ€™ attention did not waver.
Harris never wavered in his loyalty.
We were determined not to waver from our goals.
waver.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to not make a decision because you have doubts
waver.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Shareholders who were wavering met the directors.
The party wavered between free trade and protectionism.
waver.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to move gently in several different directions
waver.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The candle flame wavered, throwing shadows on the wall.
